meanings.definition: A group of related particles or entities.
meanings.sent1: In the science experiment, the researcher studied a multiplet of atoms.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper observed a multiplet of monkeys playing together.
meanings.sent3: The multiplet of colorful balloons floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The multiplet of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The multiplet of flowers in the garden added a burst of color.

meanings.definition: A set of quantum states that are indistinguishable from each other.
meanings.sent1: The physicist explained how a multiplet of electrons behaves in an atom.
meanings.sent2: The students learned about a multiplet of energy levels in quantum mechanics.
meanings.sent3: The multiplet of identical cookies on the plate disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: The multiplet of harmonious voices blended beautifully in the choir.
meanings.sent5: The multiplet of raindrops on the window created a soothing sound.
